intro: Triodanis perfoliata subsp. perfoliata, commonly known as the perfoliate triodanis, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its distinctive leaves that are fused around the stem, creating a perfoliate appearance. The plant produces small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland areas. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological studies and horticultural practices.
